intro: Struthanthus patens, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, while its stems are often hairy and succulent. Struthanthus patens is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
